field.helptext: A flag to indicate whether the page is a child page, so we can enforce that users select a new master page for the page being migrated

skuid__text.contents: Order by:
What to expect during migration

When Skuid moved to API v2, we improved our design toolkit in ways we couldn't before. However, we know it can be time consuming to migrate all of your v1 pages to v2 manually.

This migration utility is intended to ease that transition:

• It will create a v2 page based on your v1 page, converting as much as it can automatically.
  • Features that work differently--or require manual updates--will be flagged in a task list within the Composer.
  • You can revisit and resolve those migration tasks as your time allows.
  • Your v1 page will remain unchanged, and it will continue to exist until you delete it yourself.
Once all the migration tasks on this v2 page are complete, deploy it in place of your v1 page.

skuid__messageBlock.title: This name is already in use.

skuid__text.contents: Please resolve the following items:
Page name
Enter a unique name for the newly migrated page.
Design system

A page’s visual design is now set through a design system instead of a theme. If you’ve recreated your theme as a design system, select it below. Otherwise choose a different one. If needed, you can change the page's design system in the Composer later.
Master page

action.message: There was an error running the migration
There was an error running the migration

action.subtext: The migration was completed, but Skuid was unable to store your migration preferences for the next migration

skuid__text.contents: Your page has been cloned and converted to v2

If there are other migration tasks that need to be addressed, you'll see them listed in the Composer. View and dismiss tasks as they are resolved.

Remember to replace your v1 page in each place it was deployed with this v2 page after addressing all migration tasks.

action.label: If page is used in apps, don't continue with the deletion

action.message: this will take you to App Composer

skuid__text.contents: You haven't created any pages yet.

Pages are the basic building block for Skuid apps, each is an arrangement of components, models, navigation, visualizations, and layout that collectively solves a problem or creates a consistent workflow.
